course_description: This course examines some of the pivotal events, issues, organizations, and personages that have given shape to the ongoing black movement for freedom. The course adopts an investigative approach that is aesthetic, historical, ethical, sociological, political, and theological, with special attention given to the role of black religion and culture in light of contemporary challenges. (Race, Ethnicity, and Gender)
